intro: Jussiaea peruviana f. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy jussiaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and stems, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal or wetland environments. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
